intro: Trochocarpa novae-zealandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand trochocarpa, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in damp, shaded environments. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, contributing to its delicate appearance. The species is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
